briefdescription.para: [-] input message for sun data
[-] input message for spacecraft state
[-] output message for CSS output data
[-] output message for CSS configuration log data
[-] (optional) input message for sun eclipse state message
[-] (optional) input message for albedo message
[-] Specification used if state is set to COMPONENT_FAULT */
[rad] css azimuth angle, measured positive from the body +x axis around the +z axis
[rad] css elevation angle, measured positive toward the body +z axis from the x-y plane
[-] 321 Euler angles for body to platform
[-] DCM from platform frame P to body frame B
[-] css unit direction vector in body frame components
[-] unit vector to sun in B
[-] albedo irradiance measurement
[-] scale factor applied to sensor (common + individual multipliers)
[-] measurement from last update (used only for faults)
[-] solar irradiance measurement without perturbations
[-] solar irradiance measurement including perturbations
[-] Kelly curve fit for output cosine curve
[-] rad, field of view half angle
[m] position vector in body frame
[m] misalignment of CSS platform wrt spacecraft body frame
[-] Sensor bias value
[-] Sensor noise value
[-] Sensor noise value if CSSFAULT_RAND is triggered
[-] maximum output (ceiling) for saturation application
[-] minimum output (floor) for saturation application
[-] Gauss Markov walk bounds
[-] Power factor for kelly curve
[-] (optional) CSS group id identifier, -1 means it is not set and default is used
BSK Logging
[-] Unused for now, but including it for future
[-] Current SSBI-relative state
[-] scaling parameter from 0 (fully obscured) to 1 (fully visible)
[-] Factor to scale cosine curve magnitude based on solar flux at location
[-] Gauss Markov noise generation model
[-] Gauss Markov noise generation model exclusively for CSS fault
Initialize a bunch of defaults in the constructor. Is this the right thing to do?
There is nothing to do in the default destructor.
Method for reseting the module.

detaileddescription.para:
This method is used to reset the module.
CurrentSimNanos
The current simulation time from the architecture
void

listitem.para: If either messages is not valid, send a warning message

briefdescription.para: method to update state for runtime

detaileddescription.para:
This method is called at a specified rate by the architecture. It makes the calls to compute the current sun information and write the output message for the rest of the model.
CurrentSimNanos
The current simulation time from the architecture

listitem.para: Read the inputs
Get sun vector
compute true cosine
Apply any set errors
Fit kelly curve
Apply Saturation (floor and ceiling values)
Write output data

briefdescription.para: utility method to perturb CSS unit vector

detaileddescription.para: Set the unit direction vector (in the body frame) with applied azimuth and elevation angle perturbations.

parameterdescription.para: [rad] css elevation angle, measured positive toward the body z axis from the x-y plane
[rad] css azimuth angle, measured positive from the body +x axis around the +z axis

listitem.para: Rotation from individual photo diode sensor frame (S) to css platform frame (P)

inbodydescription.para: azimuth and elevation rotations of vec transpose(1,0,0) where vec is the unit normal of the photo diode
Rotation from P frame to body frame (B)

briefdescription.para: utility method to configure the platform DCM

detaileddescription.para: Set the direction cosine matrix body to css platform tranformation with 3-2-1 angle set.

parameterdescription.para: (radians) second axis rotation about interim frame +y
(radians) first axis rotation about platform frame +x

briefdescription.para: method to read the input messages

listitem.para: Zero ephemeris information
If we have a valid sun ID, read Sun ephemeris message
If we have a valid state ID, read vehicle state ephemeris message
If we have a valid eclipse ID, read eclipse message
If we have a valid albedo ID, read albedo message

briefdescription.para: method to get the sun vector information

detaileddescription.para: This method computes the sun-vector heading information in the vehicle body frame.

listitem.para: Get the position from spacecraft to Sun
Read Message data to eigen
Find sun heading unit vector
Get the inertial to body frame transformation information and convert sHat to body frame
compute sun distance factor

briefdescription.para: method to compute the true sun-fraction of CSS

detaileddescription.para: This method computes the true sensed values for the sensor

listitem.para: Apply the kelly fit to the truth direct value

briefdescription.para: method to set the actual output of the sensor with scaling/kelly

detaileddescription.para: This method takes the true observed cosine value and converts it over to an errored value. It applies noise to the truth.

listitem.para: Get current error from random number generator

briefdescription.para: scale the sensor values
apply saturation effects to sensed output (floor and ceiling)
method to write the output message to the system

detaileddescription.para:
This method writes the output message. The output message contains the current output of the CSS converted over to some discrete "counts" to emulate ADC conversion of S/C.
Clock
The current simulation time

listitem.para: Zero the output message
Set the outgoing data to the scaled computation
Write the outgoing message to the architecture

briefdescription.para: coarse sun sensor class
